nav_bot package¶

nav_bot.robot module¶

robot.py

A robot class that subscribes and publishes to all the important navigation stack topics. The class allows for control over goal-seeking behaviour and navigation. The class is intended to be used with a state machine or some other control code.

Usage: robot.py [robot_name]
robot_name: the ROS node name given to the robot.
class nav_bot.robot.Robot¶

Bases: object

A robot class

_disable_obstacle_layer()¶

Disable obstacle layer of global costmap Waits until layer is disabled

_disable_static_layer()¶

Disable the static layer of the global costmap Wait until layer is disabled

_enable_obstacle_layer()¶

Enable obstacle layer of global costmap Wait until layer is enabled

_enable_static_layer()¶

Enable the static layer of the global costmap Wait until layer is enabled

_is_reachable_distance(distance)¶

Function checks if a reasonable distance exists between robot and task (less than 100). his is a fail-safe to prevent the robot from doing impossible tasks.

Parameters:distance – float
Returns:True if distance is greater than 100m, False otherwise
Return type:bool
_is_task_in_mission(_task_id)¶

Functions checks if task exists in list of mission tasks

Parameters:_task_id – int
Returns:True if task is in mission, False otherwise
Return type:bool
init_pubs()¶

Initialise pubs This function will give control of the turtlebot3 (publish msgs to ROS)

init_subs()¶

Initialise subs and register callbacks.
